summary: The Eliminate Shutdowns Act (H.R. 5552) aims to prevent government shutdowns by providing for automatic continuing appropriations in the event of a lapse in appropriations. It amends Title 31 of the United States Code to establish a mechanism for funding programs, projects, and activities at the rate provided in the preceding applicable appropriation acts, for periods of 14 calendar days, renewable in 14-day increments. It also addresses budgetary effects related to discretionary spending limits and enforcement under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985, and specifies an effective date of September 30, 2025.
